snippet: How hundreds of volumes were taken and sold — and the library director charged with the crime — sheds light on some of the practices that continue to bedevil Italy.
abstract: Marino Massimo De Caro, former director of the storied Girolamini Library in Naples, Italy, is accused of systematically despoiling the library he had been charged with keeping safe, stealing books and selling them on the open market or directly to collectors; the question of how he ever became the director of such a renowned library sheds light on some of the entrenched practices that continue to bedevil the Italian economy.
lead_paragraph: How hundreds of volumes were taken and sold — and the library director charged with the crime — sheds light on some of the practices that continue to bedevil Italy.

headline.seo: Naples Library’s Plunder Highlights Entrenched Dealings
headline.main: At Root of Italy Library’s Plunder, a Tale of Entrenched Practices
headline.print_headline: At Root of Italy Library’s Plunder, a Tale of Entrenched Practices
